Social Engineering

In information security, social engineering is the concept of using human manipulation rather than technological means when compromising organizations or private systems. Social engineering attacks are extremely common and often used as a means to execute other types of computer based attacks. Although social engineering is often the most prevalent threat to organizations and individuals, it is one of the hardest threats to combat.

Definition

Social engineering in the context of information security is the practice of manipulating human beings as opposed to physical or virtual systems for malicious intent. Other definitions of social engineering include “manipulating a person to take an action that may or may not be in the “target's” best interest” 1) and “an act of intrusion … prepared and carried out 'socially'”. 2). Although definitions of social engineering differ slightly across publications, one common aspect they share is that the attack always involves a human component.
